at line 19
static array getAll(bool $excludeCountrySpecific = false, bool $excludeScriptSpecific = false, string $locale = '')

Return all the languages.

Parameters

bool $excludeCountrySpecific Set to false (default) to include also Country-specific languages (eg 'U.S. English' in addition to 'English'), set to true to exclude them
bool $excludeScriptSpecific Set to false (default) to include also script-specific languages (eg 'Simplified Chinese' in addition to 'Chinese'), set to true to exclude them
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

Return Value

array Return an array, sorted by values, whose keys are the language IDs and the values are the localized language names

at line 56
static string getName(string $languageCode, string $locale = '', bool $allowCompoundNames = false)

Retrieve the name of a language.

Parameters

string $languageCode The language code. If it contails also a terrotory code (eg: 'en-US'), the result will contain also the territory code (eg 'English (United States)')
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data
bool $allowCompoundNames Set to true to allow compound names (eg 'American English (United States)' instead of 'English (United States)')

Return Value

string Returns the localized language name (returns $languageCode if not found)
